problem_statement: Build an offline‑first, client‑side task management web application using Next.js, TailwindCSS, and Zod that tracks time per task, analyzes productivity patterns, and visualizes trends via interactive dashboards and burn‑down charts without requiring external APIs. Implement deterministic state management with Zustand/Redux, persistent offline storage via IndexedDB, and performance optimizations like virtualization, incremental aggregation, and Web Worker offloading to ensure responsiveness under heavy historical data. The application must prioritize reliability, correct analytics computation, and professional‑grade user experience for long‑term productivity tracking.
FAIL_TO_PASS: edits task with multiple field updates
starts time tracking for a task
stops time tracking and creates log
auto-stops previous timer when starting new one
validates Task schema with valid data
validates TimeLog schema with valid data
maintains consistent state during concurrent updates
updates updatedAt timestamp on task modification
handles errors gracefully without corrupting state
persists time logs across store resets
handles multiple tasks with same title
handles tasks with future due dates
handles tasks with past due dates
loads large number of tasks efficiently
